intro: Hieracium fioniae, commonly known as the Fionia hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium fioniae is often found in areas with mild climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
